byline.original: By RACHEL ABRAMS and ANNALYN KURTZ
byline.contributor: Rachel Abrams reported from Canton, Ohio, and Annalyn Kurtz from New York. Pradnya Joshi and Hiroko Tabuchi contributed reporting from New York, and Neal E. Boudette from Ann Arbor, Mich. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Brown became a victim of an innovation geared toward people like him when his electric sedan collided with a semitrailer, making him the first known fatality in a self-driving car.

headline.print_headline: A Driver’s Zeal, an Engineer’s Worry
headline.main: Joshua Brown, Who Died in Self-Driving Accident, Tested Limits of His Tesla

snippet: Mr. Brown became a victim of an innovation geared toward people like him when his electric sedan collided with a semitrailer, making him the first known fatality in a self-driving car....
abstract: Friends of Joshua Brown, Tesla Model S owner who died in accident while using car's Autopilot feature, describe him as technology enthusiast who was particularly enthralled with his Tesla vehicle; Brown frequently made videos celebrating car's autonomous driving feature.
